Wind power.Description: Wind power is a form of renewable energy that harnesses the power of wind to generate electricity.
Wind power uses turbines to convert the kinetic energy of wind into mechanical energy, which is then used to generate electricity.
Wind power requires grid integration to efficiently distribute the generated electricity to consumers.
Offshore wind farms are one of the ways wind power can be generated, where turbines are installed in bodies of water to take advantage of strong offshore winds.
